goodbye: Goodbye! Let me know if you need more help with your UMD tasks.

umd_ownership:
A UMD owner is the person who updates, transforms, consolidates, or maintains a UMD file.

Responsibilities include:

- Registering the UMD
- Recertifying regularly
- Ensuring accuracy and classification
umd_registration:
You can register a UMD by accessing:

 DG - Data Policy > Policies and Frameworks > User Managed Data (UMD) Framework

There, you'll find the full UMD Registration User Guide with detailed registration steps.

The UMD Registration Platform link is available on the Data Governance Portal > User Managed Data Learning Portal.

You must provide:
- File path
- Owner
- Classification
- Approver details

If you have more questions, you may contact Katrina Gob from the UMD Policy & Re-engineering Team for assistance.
dataiku_model_lifecycle:
In Dataiku:

- DSAI-developed models follow a Request â” Development â” Deployment â” Production workflow handled by the Data Science Team.
- Business-developed models start with Discovery and Development in the Design node, then follow the same deployment path via the Automation node.
dataiku_guidelines:
Dataiku is our cloud-based data science platform where teams collaboratively build, deploy, and monitor machine learning models.

Key notes:

- Models must pass the 1Rail governance process (Request â” Documentation Review â” Approval).
- Models transition from Design node (development) â” Automation node (production).
- Data storage in Dataiku (especially S3 files) is subject to retention policies.
- Business users must proactively delete unused data.
- Storage usage is monitored by EDO and ITG Cloud teams to control costs.
dataiku_asset_definitions:
A data asset in Dataiku can include:

- Datamart: A focused view of business data (mini-data warehouse)
- Data Frame: Spreadsheet-like 2D structure (rows & columns)
- Dashboard: Visual summaries of key metrics
- Report: Extracted data summaries
- Model: Structured representation of patterns in data

All assets are stored, versioned, and governed in the Cloud Data Platform (CDP).

Thanks. This file likely qualifies as a UMD.

Would you like a link to the UMD registration portal or more information about how to register the file(s)?
umd_check_not_transformed:
Since the data wasnâ€™t transformed, it does not qualify as a UMD.

You may still check with Katrina Gob from the Data Governance (UMD Re-engineering) team to confirm.
umd_status_explained:
UMD statuses indicate the current stage of the UMD registration lifecycle. UMD statuses:

- In Progress: UMD has been created but not yet approved.
- Active: Approved and actively monitored.
- Retired: No longer in use and formally decommissioned in the system.
umd_guidelines:
A UMD (User Managed Data) is any data file created or modified outside formal IT-managed systems.

A file is classified as a UMD if:

- Created using manual tools like Excel, Access, or macros
- Transformed, enriched, or consolidated manually
- Used in reporting, business decision-making, or regulatory submissions

ğŸ“„ UMDs must be registered through the UMD Registration Platform and are approved by a designated UMD Approver.

Recertification is required regularly to ensure compliance.

 Would you like to check if your file is a UMD? (yes or no)
ai_framework:
The AI and ML Model Development Framework provides a structured and responsible approach to model design, development, and deployment at the bank.

It defines key activities:

- Implementation
- Monitoring
- Evaluation

And embeds governance principles like:

- Transparency
- Fairness
- Accountability
- Privacy and security
- Safety
- Human-centricity
- Inclusiveness
- Ethical use
- Continuous monitoring and improvement
- Human-in-the-loop involvement

For the full policy, contact Data Governance or refer to the EDO portal.
data_asset_prioritisation:
The EDO Data Asset Prioritisation Guidelines classify data assets into five tiers based on:

- Business use
- Criticality

It helps the Enterprise Data Office prioritize effort allocation across managed platforms.
customer_status_framework:
The Customer Status Framework standardizes customer lifecycle definitions (onboarding to offboarding).

It covers:

- 'Active', 'Inactive', and 'Deactivated' customer statuses
- Open/Closed account status definitions

This supports 360Â° customer analytics and unified reporting across systems.

 For more definitions and rules, please navigate to DG Data Policy > Policies and Frameworks > Customer Data Standards.
